capabilities.name: Inspire Direction and Purpose
capabilities.description: The role requires communicating goals, priorities, and vision to lead a diverse team across various locations, ensuring alignment with strategic objectives.

capabilities.name: Manage and Develop People
capabilities.description: Leading a multidisciplinary team necessitates engaging, motivating, and developing the capabilities and potential of staff.

capabilities.name: Deliver Results
capabilities.description: Responsible for delivering conservation programs, visitor services, and infrastructure management, requiring efficient resource use and commitment to quality outcomes.

capabilities.name: Plan and Prioritise
capabilities.description: Must plan and deliver a diverse range of park management operations and visitor services, requiring effective prioritization and strategic planning skills.

capabilities.name: Think and Solve Problems
capabilities.description: The role involves environmental assessment, conservation planning, and incident management, necessitating advanced problem-solving skills.

capabilities.name: Communicate Effectively
capabilities.description: Requires highly skilled communication to lead change, deliver high performance, and collaborate with local communities and stakeholders.

capabilities.name: Work Collaboratively
capabilities.description: Must collaborate with a broad range of stakeholders, including Aboriginal joint management committees, requiring a strong ability to work together towards common goals.

capabilities.name: Manage Reform and Change
capabilities.description: The role involves leading change within the organization and assisting others to engage with change, requiring advanced change management skills.

capabilities.name: Finance
capabilities.description: Responsible for finance management within the area, necessitating an understanding of financial processes to achieve value for money.

capabilities.name: Project Management
capabilities.description: Oversees various conservation and infrastructure projects, requiring effective planning, coordination, and control methods.

skills.name: Strategic Leadership
skills.description: Leading a large, multidisciplinary team to achieve strategic objectives and operational goals.

skills.name: Change Management
skills.description: Effectively leading and managing change within the organization and its operations.

skills.name: Stakeholder Engagement
skills.description: Working collaboratively with local communities, Aboriginal committees, and other key stakeholders.

skills.name: Conservation Planning
skills.description: Planning and implementing conservation strategies for protected areas.

skills.name: Incident Management
skills.description: Planning and controlling incident management operations, particularly related to fire planning and response.

generalRole.title: Environmental Conservation Leader
generalRole.description: This role encompasses strategic leadership, conservation program management, stakeholder engagement, and operational acumen in managing protected area reserve systems. It requires a blend of environmental science knowledge, field operations expertise, and project delivery skills.
